snippet: An inquiry into the conduct of Central Intelligence Agency employees began after lawmakers complained that the agency was improperly monitoring the work of staff members of a Senate committee.
abstract: Protracted battle between the Central Intelligence Agency and the Senate Intelligence Committee over defunct detention and interrogation program has become a dispute over the separation of powers and congressional oversight of American spy agencies; committee has investigated program for years, and CIA's attempt to keep details about program secret has lead to investigation by its internal watchdog into conduct of agency employees.
lead_paragraph: An inquiry into the conduct of Central Intelligence Agency employees began after lawmakers complained that the agency was improperly monitoring the work of staff members of a Senate committee.

headline.main: C.I.A. Employees Face New Inquiry Amid Clashes on Detention Program
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Inquiry Is Set in Clash on Detentions
